page.title: 13Grace Swan Memorial Hospital
page.content: The 'Grace Swan' was opened in l902 from funds raised as a memorial to Mrs. Grace Swan of Sausthorpe Hall, near Spilsby. A later extension to the hospital was added in l930 by J.W.Ramsden Esq. in memory of his father. Changes in treatment techniques in past years has meant that the maternity ward and the operating theatre has closed down. Work has now been completed to convert the operating suite into extra ward space and a patient's sitting room. The hospital treats minor injuries such as cuts, bruises, small burns, insect bites and allergies. There are 20 nurses and 5 domestic staff plus the doctors which go there to treat the patents. The hospital has various problems such as large heating bills etc.
